subject: Re: Newbie
author: psi_research
full_text:
Please update us if you are able to interface the USB radio to your
computer and scan frequencies using software. That approach could make
things easier for many people. 

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "billliscomb" <williscomb@...> wrote:
>
> Hello everyone - Bill here.  Been facinated with EVPs on C2C for 
> years and a few days ago realized that I have a room full of high end 
> audio and video recording equipment, 4 computers and software to do 
> anything with anything...Hey!  I can set something up to do EVPs!  
> I've got a starter set on my desktop that worked on the first try 
> and "Rick" (my contact)has been helpful in getting it fine tuned. 
> Desktop setup uses EVPmaker chewing up a 1 minute segment of a man 
> giving a talk, with white noise (EVP said "use that noise")in a loop 
> on Soundbooth.  I use a AKG 414 mike about 18" from the computer 
> speakers and simply lean over it to ask questions, and record on to 
> Audition. 
>    My next move is to create a laptop based system using as few 
> components as possible. I'm looking at the RadioShark 2 USB am/fm 
> radio, and hoping to leave it "stock" and have it scan using 
> software.  I've found some 3rd party software that might work, but 
> don't know the particulars of the "scan" function.  Anybody here gone 
> this route or know of software that will work?  My portable sytem 
> would be the laptop, Radio Shark 2, and a microphone-and maybe a 
> Logitec external speaker.  Play white noise and radio scan thru 
> speakers, record back on computer.  Whaddya think?
>    Started my listening career in teh 1960's building Knight kit 
> shortwave radios, and still enjoy Shortwave listening - utilites 
> mostly.  EVP seems like the next level.
> Thanks
> Bill
>
